meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that necroses occur when tissue dies.
meanings.sent2: The pathologist studied the necroses found in the tissue sample.
meanings.sent3: The classroom skeleton had many necroses, making the students curious.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned building showed signs of necroses, like a ghost town frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The necroses in the garden were a stark reminder of the harsh winter.

meanings.definition: necroses: third person singular present of necrose
meanings.sent1: He necroses the infected cells to prevent further spread of the disease.
meanings.sent2: The plant necroses when exposed to extreme temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The robot gardener accidentally necroses the wrong plants, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her neglect slowly necroses the once vibrant relationship.
meanings.sent5: The toxic substance necroses the surrounding tissue, causing irreversible damage.
